ALIF#

class ALIF(shape: tuple[int, ...] | int, step_time: float, *, rest_v: float, reset_v: float, thresh_eq_v: float, refrac_t: float, tc_membrane: float, tc_adaptation: float | tuple[float], spike_adapt_increment: float | tuple[float], resistance: float = 1.0, batch_size: int = 1)[source]#

Bases: VoltageMixin, RefractoryMixin, Neuron

Simulation of adaptive leaky integrate-and-fire (ALIF) neuron dynamics

ALIF is implemented as a step of leaky integrate-and-fire applying existing adaptations, using linear spike-dependent adaptive thresholds, then updating those adaptations for the next timestep.

\[\begin{split}\begin{align*} V_m(t + \Delta t) &= \left[V_m(t) - V_\mathrm{rest} - R_mI(t)\right] \exp\left(-\frac{t}{\tau_m}\right) + V_\mathrm{rest} + R_mI(t) \\ \Theta(t) &= \Theta_\infty + \sum_k \theta_k(t) \\ \theta_k(t + \Delta t) &= \theta_k(t) \exp\left(-\frac{\Delta t}{\tau_k}\right) \end{align*}\end{split}\]

If a spike was generated at time \(t\), then.

\[\begin{split}\begin{align*} V_m(t) &\leftarrow V_\mathrm{reset} \\ \theta_k(t) &\leftarrow \theta_k(t) + a_k \end{align*}\end{split}\]
Parameters:

  • shape (tuple[int, ...] | int) – shape of the group of neurons being simulated.

  • step_time (float) – length of a simulation time step, \(\Delta t\), in \(\mathrm{ms}\).

  • rest_v (float) – membrane potential difference at equilibrium, \(V_\mathrm{rest}\), in \(\mathrm{mV}\).

  • reset_v (float) – membrane voltage after an action potential is generated, \(V_\mathrm{reset}\), in \(\mathrm{mV}\).

  • thresh_eq_v (float) – equilibrium of the firing threshold, \(\Theta_\infty$\), in \(\mathrm{mV}\).

  • refrac_t (float) – length of time the absolute refractory period lasts, in \(\mathrm{ms}\).

  • tc_membrane (float) – time constant of exponential decay for membrane voltage, \(\tau_m\), in \(\mathrm{ms}\).

  • tc_adaptation (float | tuple[float]) – time constant of exponential decay for threshold adaptations, \(\tau_k\), in \(\mathrm{ms}\).

  • spike_adapt_increment (float | tuple[float]) – amount by which the adaptive threshold is increased after a spike, \(a_k\), in \(\mathrm{mV}\).

  • resistance (float, optional) – resistance across the cell membrane, \(R_m\), in \(\mathrm{M\Omega}\). Defaults to 1.0.

  • batch_size (int, optional) – size of input batches for simualtion. Defaults to 1.

Raises:

  • ValueError – step_time must be a positive real.

  • RuntimeError – if tc_adaptation and spike_adapt_increment are tuples, they must be of equal length.

Note

For more details and references, visit Adaptive Leaky Integrate-and-Fire (ALIF) in the zoo.

clear(keep_adaptations=True)[source]#

Resets neurons to their resting state.

Parameters:

keep_adaptations (bool, optional) – if learned adaptations should be preserved. Defaults to True.

property dt: float#

Length of the simulation time step, in milliseconds.

Parameters:

value (float) – new simulation time step length.

Returns:

length of the simulation time step

Return type:

float

forward(inputs: Tensor, adapt: bool | None = None, refrac_lock: bool = True) → Tensor[source]#

Runs a simulation step of the neuronal dynamics.

Parameters:

  • inputs (torch.Tensor) – presynaptic currents, \(I(t)\), in \(\mathrm{nA}\).

  • adapt (bool | None, optional) – if adaptations should be updated based on this step. Defaults to None.

  • refrac_lock (bool, optional) – if membrane voltages should be fixed while in the refractory period. Defaults to True.

Returns:

which neurons generated an action potential.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

Note

When adapt is set to None, adaptations will be updated when the neuron is in training mode but not when it is in evaluation mode.
